title: Understanding Data Joins
text: A data join is a method used to combine two tables based on a related column. Each type of join serves a different purpose.

title: Types of Data Joins
text: The main types of data joins are Inner Join, Left Join, Right Join, and Full Outer Join. Each has a specific way of combining data from two tables and what data to omit.

title: Inner Join
text: An Inner Join returns only the rows where there is a match in both tables. It excludes non-matching rows from both tables.

title: Left Join
text: A Left Join returns all rows from the first table and the matched rows from the second table. If there is no match, the result is NULL from the second table.

title: Right Join
text: A Right Join returns all rows from the second table and the matched rows from the first table. If there is no match, the result is NULL from the first table.

title: Full Outer Join
text: A Full Outer Join returns all rows when there is a match in either table. It includes all records from both tables, filling in NULLs for non-matching rows.
